<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_irq_shutdown:
```c
void metal_linux_irq_shutdown(void)
{
	int ret;

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "%s\n", __func__);
	irq_handling_stop = true;
	metal_linux_irq_notify();
	ret = pthread_join(irq_pthread, NULL);
	if (ret) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to join IRQ thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
	}
	close(irq_notify_fd);
	metal_mutex_deinit(&irq_lock);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_linux_irq_shutdown:
static int metal_linux_irq_notify(void)
{
	uint64_t val = 1;
	int ret;

	ret = write(irq_notify_fd, &val, sizeof(val));
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s failed\n", __func__);
	}
	return ret;
}
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
...
static bool irq_handling_stop
...
static pthread_t irq_pthread
...
static int irq_notify_fd
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
close(irq_notify_fd);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The close(irq_notify_fd) statement is executed unconditionally after pthread_join in metal_linux_irq_shutdown; there is no prior return, goto, or other construct that makes it impossible to reach. It will run when pthread_join returns (either success or error path), so it is reachable.
